## Command and Military Police
These rules also apply to any individual who is promoted or is acting in the place of a MP/Command role (unless they are a member of a hostile force).\n[italic]Command roles are defined as; all heads, cic staff, mp, and squad leaders.[/italic]
- [textlink="1. Command and MP must follow Marine Law." link="RMCMarineLaw"] - [textlink="2. Command and MP are held to a higher standard of play." link="RMCHigherStandards"] - [textlink="3. MP should try to remain non-lethal and effect arrests, except in specific special circumstances." link="RMCLethalForce"] - [textlink="4. MP will be expected to answer for use of lethal force." link="RMCLethalForceConsequences"] - Only a whitelisted CO or Provost may pardon a sentence, but appeals can be done. See marine law.
